title.native: 合コンに行ったら女がいなかった話
title.romaji: Goukon ni Ittara Onna ga Inakatta Hanashi
title.english: How I Attended an All-Guy's Mixer

description:
College student Tokiwa gets invited to a mixer by his female classmate Suo. But when he arrives with his friends, they're greeted by three dazzlingly handsome men?! But as the two groups get to know each other, they find themselves getting closer in unexpected ways.

(Source: MANGA UP!)

Note: Each episode streamed 1 week early on ABEMA. The original TV broadcast started on October 4th 2024.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Drawing
tags.description: Centers around the art of drawing, including manga and doujinshi.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

title.native: 合コンに行ったら女がいなかった話

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/the_red_scanner) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/古賀一臣)

Started off doing finishing work at J.C. Staff.

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

[X (formerly Twitter)](https://x.com/asobi_doumei) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asobidoumei_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@asobi8564) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@asobidoumei?)

ASOBI DOUMEI is Japanese music duo consisting of TSUKIMIX and RiMy. They formed in 2021 and released their first single in April of 2022.

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.
